intro: Stillingia ypanemensis, commonly known as the Ypanemense stellaria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Stillingia ypanemensis is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
